body:
Thanx for explaining @mkalininait 💚 

I knew a `Conference` could be part of many `ConferenceOffers`, sorry if that wasn't clear enough in my previous comment.

So, just to illustrate things, I thought it would look like this:
![untitled diagram 3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3491815/29003266-d85f06fa-7ab3-11e7-8048-af1fe1fd7fa5.png)

Which means: one `ConferenceOffer` for a `ConferencePreference`'s `Choice 1` and one for `Choice 2`. I would have the comment to be imagined something like
> If you pick this conference, your lightning talk will be on the main track.

But if the offer is always looked at as a whole package of 2 conferences, then your approach of aligning it with the `ConferencePreference` probably makes more sense:
![untitled diagram 4](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3491815/29003474-9c5add92-7ab7-11e7-9681-46cdb21f7b9d.png)
_(super quickly thrown together, sorry)_
